section.title: Create W/O Operation
section.para: To create a Work Order Operation, select the "Create W/O Operation" option. The following screen will appear:
When creating a Work Order Operation, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter the Work Order Number of the Work Order you want to create an Operation for.
Displays Warehouse code automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Displays Item Number automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Inventory Unit of Measure.
Indicates the next available Work Order Operations sequence number.

varlistentry.term:
execution days in work orders
work orders execution days in Execution Day

listitem.para: Select a number using the arrow buttons, or manually enter a value up to a maximum of 99. (Default is "1".) Value entered defines when the specified Operation is to begin. For example, if the default value "1" is entered, the Operation will begin on the first day of the manufacturing process. If "2" is entered, the Operation will begin on the second day.
Displays the quantity ordered for the specified Item.
Displays Work Order Status automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
: Select a Standard Operation to be used, if any.

You will notice that two separate description fields are available here. This makes it possible to isolate different categories of information onto separate lines. For example, the first line might contain an Item name, while the second line contains packaging information. Having these two types of information one above the other can serve as a kind of useful shorthand when viewing data in certain windows. However, these two lines will be concatenated (i.e., "joined together") when they are printed or presented in an on-line display format.
Specify a Work Center to be used for specified Operation.

varlistentry.term: units of measure in operations Production UOM

listitem.para: Select a Unit of Measure--or enter a free-form UOM. Specify a UOM to be used optionally when Work Order Operations are posted for the specified Operation. Operations may be posted using either the Inventory or Production UOM. In addition, different Operations in a single Bill of Operations may use different Production UOMs. For example, if you are producing soup, you might mix the soup in one Operation using UOM = BATCH. But when canning the soup, the canning Operation might use UOM = CAN. If you post Operations using the Production UOM, the Inventory/Production UOM ratio normalizes the posting so that the Inventory impact is recorded using the Inventory UOM.

note.para: When posting Work Order Operations, you are given the option to post Operations using Production UOMs or Inventory UOMs.

listitem.para: When Work Order Operations are posted using the Production UOM, the Inventory/Production UOM ratio normalizes the posting so that the Inventory impact is recorded in the Inventory UOM.
Enter a tooling reference--if applicable.

note.para: Labor and overhead in w/o costing overhead Costs associated with setup and run times must be reported if they are to be tracked in the G/L and elsewhere. To report setup and run times, select the appropriate boxes in the Operation screen.

varlistentry.term:
setup time in work orders
work orders setup time for operations Total Setup Time

listitem.para: Setup Time: Amount entered represents the number of minutes required to set up the Work Center for the Operation.
Select to report setup time.
Must be selected for labor Costs associated with setup to be tracked in the G/L and elsewhere. If not selected, these Costs will not be reported.

varlistentry.term:
run time in work orders
work orders run time for operations Total Run Time

listitem.para: Run Time: Amount entered represents the total run time for the Operation measured in minutes.
Select to report run time. Must be selected for labor Costs associated with run time to be tracked in the G/L and elsewhere. If not selected, these Costs will not be reported.

Indicates the number of units, in the given Item's Inventory UOM, that can be produced in a minute--and also the number of minutes that are required to produce 1 unit, expressed in the given Item's Inventory UOM.

varlistentry.term: Receive to Stock at this Operation

listitem.para: Select if you want finished goods to be received into Inventory when this Operation is posted. Only one Work Order Operation may have this flag set. If this option is selected, the General Ledger will show the finished goods being received into Inventory when the Operation is posted.

varlistentry.term: Auto. Issue Components at this Operation

listitem.para: Select if you want linked component material to be issued automatically (i.e., backflushed) when this Operation is posted. If this option is selected, the General Ledger will show the component materials being removed from Inventory when this Operation is posted.

note.para: The "Auto. Issue" setting applies only to component Items whose issue method is either "Pull" or "Mixed". Component Items using the "Push" issue method must be issued to Work Orders using a specific material issue transaction.
